title: Torque and work - rank torques from RKE graph

content.question: A varying net torque is exerted on a disk that is rotating about a fixed axis. The disk's rotational kinetic energy as a function of angular position <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> is shown in the graph. Which of the following options correctly ranks the magnitudes <math alttext="tau sub 0 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>01</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="tau sub 1 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>12</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="tau sub 2 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>23</mn></msub></math> of the torque applied during the three intervals <math alttext="0 radians is less than theta, which is less than 1 radian" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>rad</mi><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>rad</mi></math>, <math alttext="1 radian is less than theta, which is less than 2 radians" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>1</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="2 radians is less than theta, which is less than 3 radians" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>rad</mi><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>rad</mi></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="tau sub 0 1 equals tau sub 1 2, which equals tau sub 2 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>01</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>12</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>23</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="tau sub 0 1 equals, tau sub 2 3, which is greater than tau sub 1 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>01</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>23</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>12</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="tau sub 1 2 equals, tau sub 2 3, which is less than tau sub 0 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>12</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>23</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>01</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="tau sub 1 2 is greater than tau sub 2 3, which is greater than tau sub 0 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>12</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>23</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>01</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="tau sub 0 1 equals, tau sub 2 3, which is greater than tau sub 1 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>01</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>23</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>12</mn></msub></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
